edu.jhu.coe.syntax
Class Tree<L>

java.lang.Object
  edu.jhu.coe.syntax.Tree<L>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Tree<L>>, Iterable<Tree<L>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
NamedTree
public class Tree<L>
extends Object
implements Serializable, Comparable<Tree<L>>, Iterable<Tree<L>>

Represent linguistic trees, with each node consisting of a label and a list of children.

Author:
Dan Klein Added function to get a map of subtrees to constituents.
See Also:
Serialized Form

subTrees

public Set<Tree<L>> subTrees()
Get the set of all subtrees inside the tree by returning a tree rooted at each node. These are not copies, but all share structure. The tree is regarded as a subtree of itself.

Returns:
the Set of all subtrees in the tree.

subTreeList

public List<Tree<L>> subTreeList()
Get the list of all subtrees inside the tree by returning a tree rooted at each node. These are not copies, but all share structure. The tree is regarded as a subtree of itself.

Returns:
the List of all subtrees in the tree.

subTrees

public Collection<Tree<L>> subTrees(Collection<Tree<L>> n)
Add the set of all subtrees inside a tree (including the tree itself) to the given Collection.

Parameters:
n - A collection of nodes to which the subtrees will be added
Returns:
The collection parameter with the subtrees added

iterator

public Iterator<Tree<L>> iterator()
Returns an iterator over the nodes of the tree. This method implements the iterator() method required by the Collections interface. It does a preorder (children after node) traversal of the tree. (A possible extension to the class at some point would be to allow different traversal orderings via variant iterators.)

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Tree<L>>
Returns:
An iterator over the nodes of the tree

transformNodes

public <O> Tree<O> transformNodes(Method<L,O> trans)
Applies a transformation to all labels in the tree and returns the resulting tree.

Type Parameters:
O - Output type of the transformation
Parameters:
trans - The transformation to apply
Returns:
Transformed tree

transformNodesUsingNode

public <O> Tree<O> transformNodesUsingNode(Method<Tree<L>,O> trans)
Applies a transformation to all nodes in the tree and returns the resulting tree. Different from transformNodes in that you get the full node and not just the label

Type Parameters:
O -
Parameters:
trans -
Returns:
